item.title: Magic: The Gathering TMNT Set Leaps Out of the Sewers in March
item.content:encoded:
Wizards of the Coast has revealed the latest in its Universes Beyond series of Magic: The Gathering crossovers, and I hope you're ready to get tubular, because the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles are on their way to a tabletop near you.

Launching on March 6th, the new Magic: The Gathering - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles set will feature new sets of boosters, as well as a brand new Commander deck featuring none other than the Turtles' leader himself, Leonardo.

Per a press release, while Leonardo will serve as the Commander deck's face commander, you'll also be able to take advantage of a new mechanic that allows you to combine the strength of two Commanders with the Partner ability.

In the aforementioned press release, Wizards promises that the new Turtles set for Magic: The Gathering will be perfect for any TMNT fan, whether you're a diehard fan of the original Kevin Eastman artwork or a newer convert thanks to the likes of Mutant Mayhem.

Eastman himself has returned to illustrate the new set's four headliner cards, which all feature "original borderless artwork" by the TMNT creator, as well as a "shiny stamp" of his signature.

Additionally, existing Magic: The Gathering cards will be tricked out with TMNT-themed artwork in the new set's Collector Boosters. Wizards has revealed a new Turtles-themed version of Doubling Season, but there are 20 source material cards with new artwork in total.

Not only that, but lands in the new set will be decked out with new full-art pizza variants as part of new Pizza Bundles, although Wizards promises that "the toppings are sure to be contentious". I think that's probably an understatement, given what we've seen so far.

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is just the latest property to get the Magic: The Gathering crossover treatment. It joins the likes of Final Fantasy (which proved a hugely successful crossover), Sonic the Hedgehog, and Marvel's very own Merc with a Mouth Deadpool, among many others.

The news also comes just a few months after the upcoming Magic: The Gathering movie's screenwriters were announced in the form of Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol writer Noah Gardner and Calls scribe Aidan Fitzgerald.

Magic: The Gathering's new Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles set launches on March 6th, with pre-release events happening between February 27th and March 5th. A full decklist for the Turtle Power! Commander deck will be revealed "closer to the set's release", according to Wizards.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
